transcripts.text: I made this song and music video in my bedroom while I was depressed myself.  It's a coping mechanism, and it's mine.  It won't work for everyone, but I do believe that creativity can help.  Find some way to express what's going on inside, and share it with someone.

The one that people miss.  I just tried to be someone that people would miss.  I just tried to be someone that people would miss.  Do you miss me?  Do you miss me?  Do you miss me?  Do you miss me?  Do you miss me?  Just try and be someone that people would miss.  That people would miss.

just try and be someone.  just try and be.  Just try and be me.  Just try and be me.  Me.  Strong Strong Strong Strong.  Would I be someone that people would miss?  People with masks People with masks.

Humanity, on a large scale, struggles with depression.  But the fact that we struggle with mental health in a world where for so many of us the constant threat of poverty, war, racism, sexism, transphobia, homophobia and ableism hangs over our heads is not our fault.  The fact that we feel alone in a society that is so overbearingly individualistic and centered around the self is not our fault.  The fact that you sometimes feel guilty in a society where your self-worth has been tied to your productivity, your finances, your work or your usefulness is not your fault.  The fact that so many other people on this planet are struggling with the same thing that I am is tangible proof that I am not alone.  So many people feel alone.  That alone means that you aren't.  I'd like to thank my patrons for believing in me.  If you would like to support me on Patreon, there'll be a link in the description.  And a special thanks to Kay, Jessica, LPQ Silver, Mountain Snow, Nancy T, Nellis, Reasonably Agitated Honeybee, and ThatOneGuyBrad.  Thank you all.  so, so much.  See you next time.
